result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacki L. Rickerman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --To pay mandatory statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, as directed by Agent

--No possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription

--No possession of any hypodermic needle unless medically necessary as documented by her physician

--No contact with Matthew Perales or any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent

--Random drug and/or alcohol screening at least 1x per month for first 3 months upon release from custody

--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Arresting Agency:  Watertown PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

records.addlTxt: with attached Elements & Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CF174, 14CM332 & 15CF156 called together at 3:12 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1-15CF156 & Count #1-15CF174; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case#14CM332 and all remaining Counts in Cases 15CF156 & 15CF174

On Count #1-15CF156 & Count #1-15CF174, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges (15CF156-Ct#1); to commence forthwith
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
 at least 1x per month for first 3 months upon release from custody
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, as directed by Agent
--No possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--No possession of any hypodermic needle unless medically necessary as documented by her physician
--No contact with Matthew Perales or any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--To pay mandatory statutory costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA Surcharge
--To pay $25 drug testing fee (15CF156)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

Atty Svehlek withdraws NGI plea in each case
Days credit for time already served: 1 day
 - 15CF156
Days credit for time already served: 0 days - 15CF174
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 3:31 pm
Status conference on March 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman appears via video conferencing from the Jefferson County jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. De La requests a trial date in case 14CM332; the Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court schedules separate trial in each case.
--counsel indicates a one day trial for each case
recess: 10:40am

Cases 14CM332, 15CF156 & 15CF174 called together at 4:11 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court, in-custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek: Request an additional STC in approximately 30 days, is a new matter that has been filed and are hoping a global resolution can be reached or see if these cases may change direction
ADA Hall: No objection
Court continues bond
Recess: 4:16 pm

NEXT: ALL CASES (1) Schedule STC - 1/15/16 at 10:30 - Send notices

Clerk MK realizes that the Scheduling Notice issued in court to Ms. Rickerman earlier this week indicates the next Status Conference is scheduled for 12/4/15 at 3:00pm (not the 11/30/15 date and 9:00 time shown in the minutes).  The clerk enters this note to the case file to verify that time announced in court was 12/4/15 at 3:00pm and Notice of Hearing for the next Status Conference should be sent for that date and time.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] cases #14CM332, #15CF156,#15CF174 called at 9:30am. 
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa reports that he has met with DA Happ and there is a new plea agreement-proposal; Attorney De La Rosa needs to meet with Ms. Rickerman to discuss this. 
ADA Hall indicates that the crime lab results have come back as to Case #15CF156 which confirmed that the substance was heroin.  
The Court continues the bonds. 
recess 9:35am.

Cases 15CF156, 15CF174 & 14CM332 called together at 9:43am [mo]
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock indicates that the State's witness is present for case 15CF156, but the witness summoned for Case 15CF174 is not present in the courtroom at this time
--The Court directs ADA Shock to contact the DA's office in efforts of contacting the witness for case 15CF174
--Atty. De La Rosa indicates that the Defense is prepared to proceed on all cases

On Case 15CF156(Preliminary Hearing occurs):
Officer Jacob Reitz -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa 
--re-direct examination by ADA Shock

The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Rickerman committed a felony. The Court binds her over for Arraignment & Trial.
recess: 9:55am --reconvene:10:07am (to allow ADA Shock to speak with witness for case 15CF174)

On Case 15CF174(Preliminary Hearing occurs):
Detective Sergeant Donald Hunter -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock
---State's exh. #1(Copy of Bond & Conditions for Jef. Co. Case 14CF318) offered & received 

ADA Shock idicates that parties have stipulated to identification for the purposes of this hearing only, since Detective Hunter has not had contact with Ms. Rickerman outside the courtroom.
--Atty. De La Rosa agrees
--The Court grants the stipulation for purposes of this hearing only

--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa

Atty. De La Rosa gives arguments as to lack of probable cause Count #1
The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Rickerman committed a felony. The Court binds her over for Arraignment & Trial.

ADA Shock requests an adjourned Arraignment date for Cases 15CF156 & 15CF174
--No Objection from Atty. De La Rosa 


On Case 14CM332(Status Conference):
--To follow CF cases Arraignments, as Status Conference
recess: 10:32am 

NEXT:  FOR ALL CASES: Arraingment/Status: July 24, 2015 at 10:30am

Case called at 1:19pm [mo]
[Commissioner Fremgen presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Jacki L. Rickerman appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Atty. Svehlek indicates that Ms. Rickerman is eligible for SPD representation.

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $10,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia or any item that could be used for drug use; to include needles without a valid prescription 
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
--no contact with any known drug offenders or drug houses

Atty. Svehlek requests that this case track with Ms. Rickerman's other pending case 14CM332; further Atty. Svehlek indicates that Atty. De La Rosa and DA Happ will schedule an informal Pretrial Conference prior to the Status Conference date.
--No Objection from the State

recess 1:30 pm. 


NEXT:   (1) PreTrial Conference: To be scheduled by De La Rosa/Happ (2) Status Conference on June 12, 2015 at 2:30pm
